intro: Carex stipitiutriculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and compact, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands, marshes, or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, with three stamens and a single pistil, typical of the sedge family. Carex stipitiutriculata plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
